0: In this work, we propose a new utilisation of the machine, integrating it at the core of a human creative process. Our installation where the machine projects completions without painting, combined with generative network capability, allows to explore that in a principled way. Alongside fostering creativity, the process is designed to question the growing interaction between humans and machines. With the on-going technological revolution, the human-machine interaction is deeply evolving. The use of extreme point distance criterion to determine feature points.
1: We propose a new form of human-machine interaction. Our installation where the machine projects completions without painting, combined with generative network capability, allows to explore that in a principled way. In general, point clouds are obtained by digitizing real objects with vision measuring equipment. We present a 3D stylization algorithm that can turn an input shape into the style of a cube while maintaining the content of the original shape. It is a pictorial game consisting of interactive rounds of creation between artists and a machine.
2: Our method serves as a non-realistic modeling tool where one can incorporate many artistic controls to create stylized geometries. As such, the interaction is not innocuous, even though, contrarily to our daily experience, we have made the machine impact as explicit as possible with its recognizable blue contributions. At the same time, it can effectively enhance features by the position and normal constraints.

In the following, we approach this generic idea under a specific interactive framework.
